title: Fairlands Valley Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Robin Hall / South end of Fairlands Valley Park.
images.caption: South end of Fairlands Valley Park. This photograph was taken facing north into Fairlands Valley Park from the car park used for Stevenage Borough FC (see TL2422). This park is also used for travelling fairs and circuses.

images.title: Robin Hall / Fairlands Valley Park
images.caption: Fairlands Valley Park. This large lake is used by sailors and fishermen. This photo is taken facing south. To the rear there are two smaller lakes. The park is very popular in the summer.

images.title: Jo Hennessey / Fairlands Valley Park
images.caption: This photo is of the south east bank of the largest lake, taken from near the car park and cafe

images.title: Nigel Cox / Stevenage: Fairlands Valley Park
images.caption: The upstreammost of the artificial lakes in the park, viewed looking from the footbridge, with the top of the cascade to the next lower lake just visible in the bottom of the photograph.

images.title: Nigel Cox / Stevenage: Fairlands Valley Park
images.caption: The second lake, going downstream

description: Enjoy a cycle or walk through this popular park in Stevenage. There are several pretty lakes with waterside cycling and walking paths to enjoy. The park covers 120 acres and includes some woodland trails and an on site cafe. To continue your walking in the Stevenage area head just a mile south west of the park to visit Knebworth Country Park. The park consists of 250 acres of rolling hills with ancient chestnut and lime avenues. There's also lots of deer to look out for there too.
